references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a foundational vision-language model that serves as the basis for the experiments in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Scaling up visual and vision-language representation learning with noisy text supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces ALIGN, another significant vision-language model used as a comparison point in evaluating the effectiveness of the proposed method.
This paper introduces the concept of selective forgetting and proposes the LSF method, which is directly relevant to the task addressed by the target paper.
This paper proposes BBT, a black-box prompt tuning method that is used as a baseline comparison for the target paper's approach.
This paper is another relevant work on the selective forgetting problem, providing another comparison point for evaluating the target method.
